title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *President Trump is scheduled to finish his time in office and departs the White House with his wife, [[Melania Trump]]. His incoming successor, [[Joe Biden]], is scheduled to be inaugurated as the 46th President at noon EST. Donald Trump is scheduled to begin his post-presidency.

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *President Trump is scheduled to finish his time in office and departs the White House with his wife, [[Melania Trump]]. His incoming successor, [[Joe Biden]], is scheduled[[Inauguration of Joe Biden|to be inaugurated]]as the 46th President at noon EST. Donald Trump is scheduled to begin his post-presidency.

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
deleted: *President Trump is scheduled to finish his time in office and departs the White House with his wife, [[Melania Trump]]. His incoming successor, [[Joe Biden]], is scheduled [[Inauguration of Joe Biden|to be inaugurated]] as the 46th President at noon EST. Donald Trump is scheduled to begin his post-presidency.

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: * President Trump condemns the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|attack]] on the [[United States Capitol]] and [[Concession (politics)|concedes]] the race for the first time. He also says that his focus is to ensure a [[Peaceful transition of power|smooth transition of power]] to the [[Presidency of Joe Biden|Biden administration]] (without mentioning Biden's name).<ref>https://www.newsweek.com/full-text-speech-which-donald-trump-finally-concedes-election-biden-1559880</ref><ref>https://www.denverpost.com/2021/01/07/trump-condemns-capitol-riot-concedes-biden/</ref><ref>https://www.forbes.com/sites/rachelsandler/2021/01/07/trump-concedes-election-defeat-commits-to-peaceful-transition-of-power/?sh=7e8286d13212</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
deleted: *Speaking on behalf of the President due to his Twitter ban [[White House Deputy Chief of Staff]], [[Dan Scavino]] tweets that Trump has said "there will be an [[orderly transition of power]] on January 20th" even though he "totally disagrees with the outcome of the election".<ref>https://twitter.com/DanScavino/status/1347103015493361664</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
deleted: *Senator [[Bernie Sanders]] of [[Vermont]] presents a display of Trump's tweet calling for $2,000.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.mediaite.com/tv/bernie-sanders-displays-giant-trump-tweet-on-senate-floor-to-whack-gop-colleagues-over-2000-payments-the-president-is-right/|title=Bernie Sanders Uses Trump Tweet to Fire Back at GOP on $2000|date=December 30, 2020}}</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
deleted: *President Trump announces he will not attend the Inauguration of Joe Biden on January 20th.

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: * Biden overtakes President Trump's leads in Michigan and Wisconsin further jeopardizing the presidents re-election chances. Election winner remains to be called.<ref name="AP"/>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *The [[PGA Tour|Professional Golfer's Association]] announced the PGA Championship will no longer be taking place at President Trump's Golf course in New Jersey as they say it would be ''"detrimental to the brand".''<ref>https://news.sky.com/story/donald-trump-pga-championship-will-no-longer-take-place-at-presidents-golf-course-12184866</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *President Trump and Vice President Pence speaks for the first time since the storming of the Capitol.<ref>https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/533734-trump-and-pence-speak-for-first-time-since-capitol-riots</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *President Trump approves a [[state of emergency|emergency]] declaration ahead of [[Inauguration of Joe Biden|Joe Biden's inauguration]].<ref>https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/11/donald-trump-dc-state-of-emergency-inauguration-457890</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *President Trump approves a [[state of emergency|emergency]] declarationfrom [[Mayor of the District of Columbia|DC Mayor]] [[Muriel Bowser]]ahead of [[Inauguration of Joe Biden|Joe Biden's inauguration]].<ref>https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/11/donald-trump-dc-state-of-emergency-inauguration-457890</ref><ref>https://www.foxnews.com/us/trump-emergency-dc-biden-inauguration</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *President Trump speaks publicly for the first time since his permanent Twitter ban and articles of Impeachment being drawn against him.

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *Vice President Mike Pence acknowledges that the Trump presidency is coming to an end, and said that the administration is working with President-elect Joe Biden's transition team.<ref>https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/533880-pence-promises-governors-smooth-transition-in-task-force-call</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
deleted: *Vice President Mike Pence acknowledges that the Trump presidency is coming to an end, and said that the administration is working with President-elect Joe Biden's transition team.<ref>https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/533880-pence-promises-governors-smooth-transition-in-task-force-call</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *Vice President Mike Pence tells [[Speaker of the United States House of Representatives|House Speaker]] [[Nancy Pelosi]] that he won't invoke the [[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution|25th amendment]].<ref>https://www.chicagotribune.com/election-2020/ct-trump-capitol-riot-20210112-ltxwk656xreaxftpvqolxgvska-story.html</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *First Lady Melania Trump delivers a farewell address, urging Americans to [[Be Best]].<ref>https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/1/18/first-lady-melania-trump-releases-farewell-message</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *The Trump administration declares that [[China]] has committed [[Uyghur genocide|genocide]] against [[Uyghurs|Uyghur]] Muslims and other ethnic minority groups.<ref>https://www.cbsnews.com/news/china-sanctions-uighur-muslims-genocide-mike-pompeo/</ref>

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: *President Trump finishes his time in office and departs the White House with his wife, [[Melania Trump]]. His successor, [[Joe Biden]], is inaugurated as the 46th President at noon EST. Donald Trump begins his post-presidency.

title: Timeline of Donald Trump's first presidency (2020 Q4–January 2021)
added: * President Trump arrives at the [[Palm Beach International Airport]] and heads to [[Mar-a-Lago]].<ref>https://www.palmbeachpost.com/story/news/local/westpb/2021/01/20/trump-lands-florida-biden-supporters-scarce-route-mar-lago/4221621001/</ref>

deleted: *President Trump speaks publicly for the first time since his permanent Twitter ban and articles of Impeachment being drawn against him calling it a ''"continuation of the greatest witch hunt in political history"'' when speaking to reporters.
